title: Khwarrahbud
text: Khwarrahbud was a 4th-century <a href="Iranian%20people">Iranian</a> scribe ("<a href="dabir">dabir</a>") active during the reign of the <a href="Sasanian%20Empire">Sasanian</a> king (<a href="shah">shah</a>) <a href="Shapur%20II">Shapur II</a> (). Attested in Armenian as "Khorōhbowt", Khwarrahbud was captured during Shapur II's wars against the <a href="Roman%20Empire">Romans</a>. During his stay in Roman territory, Khwarrahbud learned <a href="Ancient%20Greek">Greek</a> and wrote a book on the accomplishments of Shapur II and <a href="Julian%20%28emperor%29">Julian</a>. Furthermore, Khwarrahbud also later translated into Greek a <a href="Middle%20Persian">Persian</a> book written by Rāstsakhwan (attested in Armenian as "Rastsohown"), one of his captive associates. The book was later used by the 6th-century historian <a href="Agathias">Agathias</a>.
